channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fltipped Material + Burnt Flytip, 29th March
item.description:
The location is again the Old Quarry entrance off Cleeve Common Road and boith sides of the entrance wall. A fire was set there and now consists of burnt metal together with a fire extinguisher body. On the road side of the entrance wall - the area is littered with rubbish and pieces of board. Please can it all be thoroughly cleared up as it is an AONB footpath

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste all over the road, 29th March
item.description:
Man throwing bread and food waste all.over the road. Nothing done after 3rd time of reporting as far as I'm aware. This is attracting rats.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 39 Humber Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping of Assorted Material, 25th March
item.description:
The location is on the road going towards Whittington and about100 yards past the turning to Picadilly Farm at the top of Aggs Hill - just before the Cotswold Way and woods - on the right hand side. There is a layby / passing Place / field gate in which the material has been dumped. It seems to consist of a mixture of garden waste and other rubbish which should not be in the countryside. Please can it be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped Garden Waste and Other Rubbish, 25th March
item.description:
The location is on the Cleeve Common Road on the right Hand side at the top of the hill - where the entrance to the woods and a layby are. The material is garden waste, rubble and other rubbish in the area. Please can this be cleared up as it's presence will attract other dumps.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
